info.text: The default category for questions shared in context '7.3 Determinants'.

questiontext.text:
Determinant of a \(2\times2\) matrix Determinant for en \ (2 \ Times2 \) matrise

The determinant of the matrix \(A=\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}\) is denoted by \(\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}\) (note the change from square brackets to vertical lines) and is defined to be the number \(ad-bc\). That is: \[\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = ad-bc.\] Determinanten av matrisen \(a = \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}\) er betegnet med \(\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}\) (Legg merke til endringen fra firkantede parenteser til vertikale linjer) og er definert til å være tallet \(ad-bc\). Det vil si: \[\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = ad-bc.\]

We can use the notation \(\det(A)\) or \(\lvert A \rvert\) to denote the determinant of \(A\). A common symbol used to represent the determinant of a given matrix is \(\Delta.\) Vi kan bruke notasjonen \(\det(A)\) or \(\lvert A \rvert\) for å betegne determinanten for \(A\). Et vanlig symbol som brukes til å representere determinanten for en gitt matrise er \(\Delta.\)

name.text: 7.3.2.1 Laplace expansion along the top row, minors

questiontext.text:
Laplace expansion along the top row Laplace-utvidelse langs den øverste raden

This is a technique which can be used to evaluate determinants of any order. In principle, this method can use any row or any column as its starting point. We quote one example: using the top row. Dette er en teknikk som kan brukes til å evaluere determinanter for enhver rekkefølge. I prinsippet kan denne metoden bruke hvilken som helst rad eller hvilken som helst kolonne som utgangspunkt. Vi ser nå et eksempel: ved bruk av den øverste raden.

Consider \(\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 3 & 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix}\). Se på \(\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 3 & 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix}\).

First we introduce the idea of a minor. Each element in this array of numbers has an associated number called its minor, calculated by removing the column and row in which the element lies and taking the determinant of the remainder. For example consider entry \(a_{23}=3\). To calculate the minor associated with this entry, we strike out the second row and the third column: Først introduserer vi ideen om en 'minor' . Hvert element i denne rekke tall har et tilknyttet antall kalt for en 'minor', beregnet ved å fjerne kolonnen og raden der elementet ligger og tar determinanten for resten. Vi ser på et eksempel: \(a_ {23} = 3\). For å beregne den 'minor' tilknyttet denne eksempelen, slår vi ut den andre raden og den tredje kolonnen:



which leaves \(\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = 4 - 3 = 1.\) For the index \(a_{31}=3\) we strike out the third row and first column: som forlater \(\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = 4 - 3 = 1.\). For index \(a_{31}=3\) slår vi ut den tredje raden. Og først kolonne:



which leaves \(\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & 3 \end{vmatrix} = 3 - 2 = 1.\) som forlater \(\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & 3 \end{vmatrix} = 3 - 2 = 1.\)

Cofactors Kofaktorer

A cofactor is a minor with a sign attached. The appropriate sign comes from the pattern of signs appropriate to a \(3 \times 3\) array: \[\begin{bmatrix}+&-&+\\ -&+&-\\ +&-&+\end{bmatrix}\] (i.e. positive signs on the leading diagonal and the signs "alternate" everywhere else.) En kofaktor er en 'minor' med et skilt festet. Det aktuelle tegnet kommer fra mønsteret av tegn som er passende for en \(3\times 3\) array: \[\begin{bmatrix}+&-&+\\ -&+&-\\ +&-&+\end{bmatrix}\] (dvs. positive tegn på den ledende diagonalen og skiltene "veksler" overalt ellers.)

Each entry of a matrix \(A\) has a cofactor associated with it. The cofactor of entry \(a_{11}\) is denoted by \(A_{11}\), that of \(a_{23}\) by \(A_{23}\) and so on. Hver oppføring av en matrise \(a\) har en kofaktor tilknyttet den. Kofaktoren til elementet \(a_{11}\) er betegnet av \(a_ {11}\), det av \(a_{23}\) av \(a_{23} \) og så videre.

To obtain the cofactor of an element of a \(3\times 3\) matrix we simply multiply the minor of that element by the corresponding sign from the \(3\times 3\) array of signs. For å få kofaktoren til et element i en \(3 \times 3\) matrise, multipliserer vi ganske enkelt det mindre av det elementet med det tilsvarende tegnet fra \(3 \times 3 \) utvalg av skilt.

Hence, for the matrix \(A = \begin{bmatrix} 4 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 3 & 1 & 2 \end{bmatrix}\), the cofactor corresponding to \(a_{23}\) is \[A_{23} = - \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = -1\] and the cofactor corresponding to \(a_{31}\) is \[A_{31} = + \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & 3 \end{vmatrix}=1.\] Derfor, for matrisen \(a = \begin{bmatrix} 4 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 3 & 1 & 2 \end{bmatrix} \), kofaktoren som tilsvarer \(a_ {23}\) er \[A_ {23} = - \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = -1 \] og kofaktoren som tilsvarer \(a_ {31} \) er \[A_ {31} = + \begin {vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & 3 \end{vmatrix} = 1. \]

Evaluating general determinants Evaluering av generelle determinanter

Cofactors are important as it can be shown that the value of the determinant \(\Delta\) of a \(3\times 3\) matrix \(A\) can be found from the formula \(\Delta=a_{11}A_{11}+a_{12}A_{12}+a_{13}A_{13}.\) Kofaktorer er viktige, da det kan vises at verdien av determinanten \(\delta \) for en \(3 \times 3 \) matrise \(a \) finner du fra formelen \(\Delta = A_{11} A_{11}+a_{12} a_{12}+a_{13} a_{13}. \)

In words, "the determinant of a \(3\times 3\) matrix is obtained by multiplying each element of the first row by its corresponding cofactor and then adding the three together". (In fact this rule can be extended to apply to any row or any column and to any order square matrix.) Med andre ord, "er determinanten for en \(3 \times 3 \) matrise oppnådd ved å multiplisere hvert element i den første raden med den tilsvarende kofaktoren og deretter legge til de tre sammen". (Faktisk kan denne regelen utvides til å gjelde for hvilken som helst rad eller hvilken som helst kolonne og til hvilken som helst ordnet firkantet matrise.)

Key Point Sentralt punkt

Evaluating General Determinants Evaluering av Generelle Determinanter

If \(A\) is an \(n\times n\) square matrix then: \(\displaystyle{\operatorname{det}(A) = \sum_{j=1}^{n}a_{ij}A_{ij}}\). Hvis \(a \) er en \(n \times n \) firkantet matrise da: \(\displaystyle{\operatorname{det}(A) = \sum_{j=1}^{n}a_{ij}A_{ij}}\).

In words: The determinant of a square matrix is obtained by multiplying each element of row \(i\) by its corresponding cofactor and then adding these products together. Med andre ord: "Determinanten til en firkantet matrise fåes ved å multiplisere hvert element av råd \(i\) med sin korresponderende kofaktor og da legger til de produktene sammen.

Example Eksempel

In the case of \(\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 3 & 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix}\) we have \(a_{11}=4, a_{12}=1, a_{13}=1,\) and \begin{align*} A_{11} & = + \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = 4 - 3 = 1, \\ A_{12} & = - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = - ( 2 - 9 ) = 7, \\ A_{13} & = + \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = 1 - 6 = - 5.\end{align*} Når det, \(a_{12} = 1, a_{13} = 1, \) og \begin{align*} a_ {11} & = + \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} =4 - 3 = 1, \\ a_{12} & = - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = - (2 - 9) = 7, \\ a_{13} &= + \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = 1 - 6 = - 5. \end{align*}

Hence, \(\Delta=4\times 1 + 1\times 7 + 1\times -5 = 6\). Derfor, \(\Delta = 4 \times 1 + 1 \times 7 + 1 \times -5 = 6 \).

Alternatively, choosing to expand along the second row: \begin{align*}\Delta & = a_{21} A_{21} + a_{22} A_{22} + a_{23} A_{23} \\ & = 1 \left( - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 2 \left( \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 3 \left( - \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} \right) \\ & = 6\end{align*} as before. Alternativt å velge å utvide langs den andre raden: \begin{align*}\Delta & = a_{21} A_{21} + a_{22} A_{22} + a_{23} A_{23} \\ & = 1 \left( - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 2 \left( \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 3 \left( - \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} \right) \\ & = 6\end{align*} som før.

Key Point

Evaluating General Determinants

If \(A\) is an \(n\times n\) square matrix then: \(\displaystyle{\operatorname{det}(A) = \sum_{j=1}^{n}a_{ij}A_{ij}}\).

In words: The determinant of a square matrix is obtained by multiplying each element of row \(i\) by its corresponding cofactor and then adding these products together.

In the case of \(\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 3 & 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix}\) we have \(a_{11}=4, a_{12}=1, a_{13}=1,\) and \begin{align*} A_{11} & = + \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = 4 - 3 = 1, \\ A_{12} & = - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = - ( 2 - 9 ) = 7, \\ A_{13} & = + \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = 1 - 6 = - 5.\end{align*}

Hence, \(\Delta=4\times 1 + 1\times 7 + 1\times -5 = 6\).

Alternatively, choosing to expand along the second row: \begin{align*}\Delta & = a_{21} A_{21} + a_{22} A_{22} + a_{23} A_{23} \\ & = 1 \left( - \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 2 \left( \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 3 \left( - \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} \right) \\ & = 6\end{align*} as before.

Properties of determinants

Often, especially with determinants of large order, we can simplify the evaluation rules. Let's discuss some useful properties of determinants in general.

  1. If two rows (or two columns) of a determinant are interchanged then the value of the determinant is multiplied by \(-1\).

    For example, \(\begin{vmatrix}4&3\\ 1&2\end{vmatrix}=8-3=5\), but (interchanging columns) \(\begin{vmatrix}3&4\\2&1\end{vmatrix}=3-8=-5\) and (interchanging rows) \(\begin{vmatrix}1&2\\ 4&3\end{vmatrix}=3-8=-5\).

  2. The determinant of a matrix \(A\) and the determinant of its transpose \(A^T\) are equal.

    \[ \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{vmatrix} = 4 - 6 = -2 = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 2 & 4 \end{vmatrix} \]

  3. If two rows (or two columns) of a matrix \(A\) are equal, then it has zero determinant.

    For example, the following determinant has two identical rows:

    \[\begin{aligned} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{vmatrix} &= 1 \times \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 5 & 6 \end{vmatrix} + 2 \times \left(- \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 4 & 6 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 3 \times \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 & 5 \end{vmatrix} \\ & = -3 + 2 \times 6 + 3 \times (-3) = 0. \end{aligned}\]

  4. If the elements of one row (or one column) of a determinant are multiplied by \(k\), then the resulting determinant is \(k\) times the given determinant.

    \[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 8 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 &  9 \end{vmatrix} = 2 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 2 & 4 & 3 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{vmatrix}.\]

    Note that if one row (or column) of a determinant is a multiple of another row (or column) then the value of the determinant is zero. (This follows from properties 3 and 4.)

    For example:

    \[\begin{aligned} \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 4 & -1 \\ 4 & 2 & 1 \\ -4 & -8 & 2 \end{vmatrix} & = 2 \times \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ -8 & 2 \end{vmatrix} +4 \times \left( -\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ -4 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) - 1 \times \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 2 \\ -4 & -8 \end{vmatrix} \\ & = 2(12)+4(-12)-(-24)=0. \end{aligned}\]

    This is predictable as the 3rd row is \(-2\) times the first row.

  5. If we add (or subtract) a multiple of one row (or column) to another, the value of the determinant is unchanged.

    Given \(\begin{vmatrix}1&2\\ 4&5\end{vmatrix}\), adding (2 \(\times\) row 1) to (row 2) gives

    \[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 + 2 \times 1 & 5 + 2 \times 2 \end{vmatrix} = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 6 & 9 \end{vmatrix} = 9 - 12 = -3 = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 & 5 \end{vmatrix} \]

  6. The determinant of a lower triangular matrix, an upper triangular matrix or a diagonal matrix is the product of the elements on the leading diagonal.

    As an example, it is easily confirmed that each of the following determinants has the same value \(1 \times 4 \times 6 = 24\).

    \[ \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 4 & 5 \\ 0 & 0 & 6 \end{vmatrix},\qquad \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 2 & 4 & 0 \\ 3 & 5 & 6 \end{vmatrix},\qquad \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 4 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 6 \end{vmatrix},\qquad \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 & 5 \\ 0 & 0 & 6 \end{vmatrix} \]

Egenskaper til determinanter

Ofte, spesielt med determinanter av stor størrelse, kan vi forenkle evalueringsreglene. La oss diskutere noen nyttige egenskaper til determinanter generelt.

  1. Hvis to rader (eller to kolonner) av en determinant byttes ut, er verdien til determinanten multiplisert med \(-1\).

    For eksempel, \(\begin{vmatrix}4&3\\ 1&2\end{vmatrix}=8-3=5\), men (bytter kolonner) \(\begin{vmatrix}3&4 \\2&1\end{vmatrix}=3-8=-5\) og (bytte rader) \(\begin{vmatrix}1&2\\ 4&3\end{vmatrix}=3-8=- 5\).

  2. Determinanten til en matrise \(A\) og determinanten for dens transponering \(A^T\) er like.

    \[ \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{vmatrix} = 4 - 6 = -2 = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 2 & 4 \end{vmatrix} \]

  3. Hvis to rader (eller to kolonner) i en matrise \(A\) er like, har den null determinant.

    For eksempel har følgende determinant to identiske rader:

    \[\begin{aligned} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{vmatrix} &= 1 \times \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 5 & 6 \end{vmatrix} + 2 \times \left(- \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 4 & 6 \end{vmatrix} \right) + 3 \times \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 & 5 \end{vmatrix} \\ & = -3 + 2 \times 6 + 3 \times (-3) = 0. \end{aligned}\]

  4. Hvis elementene i én rad (eller én kolonne) i en determinant multipliseres med \(k\), er den resulterende determinanten \(k\) ganger den gitte determinanten.

    \[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 8 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 &  9 \end{vmatrix} = 2 \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 2 & 4 & 3 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{vmatrix}.\]

    Merk at hvis en rad (eller kolonne) av en determinant er et multiplum av en annen rad (eller kolonne), så er verdien av determinanten null. (Dette følger av egenskap 3 og 4.)

    For eksempel:

    \[\begin{aligned} \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 4 & -1 \\ 4 & 2 & 1 \\ -4 & -8 & 2 \end{vmatrix} & = 2 \times \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ -8 & 2 \end{vmatrix} +4 \times \left( -\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ -4 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \right) - 1 \times \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 2 \\ -4 & -8 \end{vmatrix} \\ & = 2(12)+4(-12)-(-24)=0. \end{aligned}\]

    Dette er forutsigbart ettersom den tredje raden er \(-2\) ganger den første raden.

  5. Hvis vi legger til (eller trekker fra) et multiplum av en rad (eller kolonne) til en annen, er verdien av determinanten uendret.

    Gitt \(\begin{vmatrix}1&2\\ 4&5\end{vmatrix}\), gir å legge til (2 \(\times\) rad 1) til (rad 2)

    \[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 + 2 \times 1 & 5 + 2 \times 2 \end{vmatrix} = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 6 & 9 \end{vmatrix} = 9 - 12 = -3 = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 4 & 5 \end{vmatrix} \]

  6. Determinanten for en nedre trekantet matrise, en øvre trekantet matrise eller en diagonal matrise er produktet av elementene på ledende diagonal.

    Som et eksempel er det lett å bekrefte at hver av de følgende determinantene har samme verdi \(1 \times 4 \times 6 = 24\).

    \[ \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 4 & 5 \\ 0 & 0 & 6 \end{vmatrix},\qquad \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 2 & 4 & 0 \\ 3 & 5 & 6 \end{vmatrix},\qquad \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 4 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 6 \end{vmatrix},\qquad \begin{vmatrix} 4 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 & 5 \\ 0 & 0 & 6 \end{vmatrix} \]

Exercise Trening

Evaluate the determinants of the following matrices. Evaluer determinantene for følgende matriser.

  1. \(A={@matrixa@}\)
  2. \(B={@matrixb@}\)
  3. \(C={@matrixc@}\)

  1. \(\det{A}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. \(\det{B}=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. \(\det{C}=\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
We use the definition to find the determinant of the following matrices. Vi bruker definisjonen for å finne determinanten for følgende matriser.

  1. For \(A={@matrixa@},\)

    \(\det(A) = {@detAA@} = {@ta1@}.\)

  2. For \(B={@matrixb@},\)

    \(\det(B) = {@detBB@} = {@ta2@}.\)

  3. For \(C={@matrixc@},\)

    \(\det(C) = {@detCC@} = {@ta3@}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Evaluate the determinants of the following matrices.

  1. \(A={@matrixa@}\)
  2. \(B={@matrixb@}\)
  3. \(C={@matrixc@}\)
  4. \(D={@matrixd@}\)
  5. \(E={@matrixe@}\)
  6. \(F={@matrixf@}\)
  7. \(G={@matrixg@}\)

  1. \(\det{A}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. \(\det{B}=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. \(\det{C}=\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

  4. \(\det{D}=\) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

  5. \(\det{E}=\) [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]]

  6. \(\det{F}=\) [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]] [[feedback:prt6]]

  7. \(\det{G}=\) [[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]] [[feedback:prt7]]

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Trening

Consider the matrix \(A = {@matrixa@}\). What is the minor of the index \(a_{22}\)? Tenk på matrisen \(A = {@matrixa@}\). Hva er den 'minor' av indeksen \(a_{22}\)?

The minor of \(a_{22}\) is: Den 'minor' av \(a_{22}\) er: [[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
The minor of \(a_{22}\) is the \(2\times2\) determinant \(\begin{vmatrix}a_{11} & a_{13} \\ a_{31} & a_{33}\end{vmatrix}=a_{11}a_{33}-a_{31}a_{13}\). Den mindreårige av \(A_ {22} \) er \(2 \times 2\) determinant \(\begin{vmatrix} a_ {11} & a_ {13} \\ a_ {31} & a_ {33} \end{vmatrix} = a_ {11} a_ {33}-a_ {31} a_ {13}\).

For the matrix \(A = {@matrixa@}\) the minor is: For matrisen \(a = {@matrixa@}\) er den mindreårige:

\(\begin{vmatrix}{@AA[1,1]@} & {@AA[1,3]@} \\ {@AA[3,1]@} & {@AA[3,3]@}\end{vmatrix} = {@CC@} = {@ta1@}.\) \(\begin{vmatrix}{@AA[1,1]@} & {@AA[1,3]@} \\ {@AA[3,1]@} & {@AA[3,3]@}\end{vmatrix} = {@CC@} = {@ta1@}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Trening

Consider the matrix \(A = {@matrixa@}\). Compute the cofactors of the following entries: Tenk på matrisen \(a = {@matrixa@} \). Beregn kofaktorene for følgende oppføringer:

  1. The cofactor of \(a_{22}\) is: Kofaktoren til \(a_{22}\) er: [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]
  2. The cofactor of \(a_{23}\) is: Kofaktoren til \(a_{23}\) er: [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the matrix \(A = {@matrixa@}.\) Vi får matrisen \ (a = {@matrixa@}. \)

  1. The minor of \(a_{22}\) is the \(2\times2\) determinant \(\begin{vmatrix}a_{11} & a_{13} \\ a_{31} & a_{33}\end{vmatrix}=a_{11}a_{33}-a_{31}a_{13}\). In this case, the minor is: \[\begin{vmatrix}{@AA[1,1]@} & {@AA[1,3]@} \\ {@AA[3,1]@} & {@AA[3,3]@}\end{vmatrix} = {@minorA22@} = {@ta1@}\]

    The sign in the position of \(a_{22}\) in the array of signs is \(+\), the cofactor of \(a_{22}\) is \(A_{22}=+{@ta1@}\). Legnet i posisjonen til \(a_ {22} \) i rekke skilter er \(+\), kofaktoren til \(a_ {22} \) er \(a_ {22} =+{@ta1@} \).

    Den mindreårige av \(A_ {22} \) er \(2 \times2 \) determinant \(\begin{vmatrix} a_{11} & a_{13} \\ a_{31} & a_{33} \end{vmatrix} = a_{11} a_{33} - a_{31} a_{13} \).I dette tilfellet er den minor: \[\begin{vmatrix}{@aa [1,1]@} & {@aa [1,3]@} \\ {@aa [3,1]@} & {@Aa [3,3]@} \end{vmatrix} = {@minora22@} = {@ta1@}\]

    skiltet i posisjonen til \(a_{22} \) i utvalget av skilt er \(+\), kofaktoren til \(a_{22} \) er \(a_{22} =+{@ta1@} \). legnet i posisJonen til \(a_{22} \) i rekke Skilter er \(+\), Kofaktoren til \(a_{22} \) er \(a_{22} =+{@ta1@} \).

  2. The minor of \(a_{22}\) is the \(2\times2\) determinant \(\begin{vmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\ a_{31} & a_{32}\end{vmatrix}=a_{11}a_{32}-a_{31}a_{12}\). In this case, the minor is: \[\begin{vmatrix}{@AA[1,1]@} & {@AA[1,2]@} \\ {@AA[3,1]@} & {@AA[3,2]@}\end{vmatrix} = {@minorA23@} = {@minorA23s@}\]

    The sign in the position of \(a_{23}\) in the array of signs is \(-\), so the cofactor of \(a_{23}\) is \(A_{23}={@cofA23@}\). Legnet i plasseringen av \(a_{23} \) i rekke skilter er \(-\), så kofaktoren til \(a_{23} \) er \(a_ {23} = {@cofa23@} \).

    Den mindreårige av \(a_{22} \) er \(2 \times2 \) determinant \(\begin{VMatrix} a_{11} & a_{12} \\ a_{31} & a_{32} \end{vmatrix} = a_{11} a_{32} -a_{31} a_{12} \).I dette tilfellet er den mindreårige: \[\begin{vmatrix}{@aa [1,1]@} & {@aa [1,2]@} \\ {@aa [3,1]@} & {@Aa [3,2]@} \end{vmatrix} = {@minora23@} = {@minora23s@} \]

    Legnet i plasseringen av \(a_{23}\) i rekke skilter er \(-\), så kofaktoren til \(a_{23} \) er \(a_{23} = {@cofa23@} \). legnet i plasseringen av \(a_{23} \) i rekke Skilter er \(-\), sjofaktoren til \(a_{23} \) er \(a_{23} = {@cofa23@} \).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Trening

By expanding along the first row, compute the determinant of the matrix \(A = {@matrixa@}\). Ved å utvide langs den første raden, beregne determinanten for matrisen \(a = {@matrixa@} \).

The determinant \(\Delta\) is: Determinanten \(\Delta\) er:

[[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
For \(A={@matrixa@}\), we have: \begin{align*} a_{11} & = {@matrixa[1,1]@}, & a_{12} & = {@matrixa[1,2]@}, & a_{13} & = {@matrixa[1,3]@}, \\ A_{11} & = \det{{@AA11@}} = {@determinant(AA11)@}, & A_{12} & = \det{{@AA12@}} = {@determinant(AA12)@}, & A_{13} & = \det{{@AA13@}} = {@determinant(AA13)@}. \end{align*}

Therefore \[\Delta = a_{11}A_{11}+a_{12}A_{12}+a_{13}A_{13} = {@ta1@}.\]

For \(A={@matrixa@}\), vi har: \begin{align*} a_{11} & = {@matrixa[1,1]@}, & a_{12} & = {@matrixa[1,2]@}, & a_{13} & = {@matrixa[1,3]@}, \\ A_{11} & = \det{{@AA11@}} = {@determinant(AA11)@}, & A_{12} & = \det{{@AA12@}} = {@determinant(AA12)@}, & A_{13} & = \det{{@AA13@}} = {@determinant(AA13)@}. \end{align*}

Derfor \[\Delta = a_{11}A_{11}+a_{12}A_{12}+a_{13}A_{13} = {@ta1@}.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Example

This exercise is in five parts. Consider the determinant \[\Delta = \det{@matrixa@}\]

  1. Use property 2 to find another matrix whose determinant is equal to \(\Delta\):

    [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Now expand along the top row to express \(\Delta\) as the difference of two products, each of a number and a \(3\times 3\) determinant:

    \(\Delta=\) [[input:ans21]] [[validation:ans21]]\(\times\det\)[[input:ans22]] [[validation:ans22]] \(-\) [[input:ans23]] [[validation:ans23]] \(\times\det\) [[input:ans24]] [[validation:ans24]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. Use property 4 to evaluate the first \(3\times3\) determinant: [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

  4. Use property 4 to evaluate the second \(3\times3\) determinant: [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

  5. Deduce the value of \(\Delta\): [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]]

Eksempel

Denne øvelsen er i fem deler. Tenk på determinanten \[\Delta = \det{@matrixa@}\]

  1. Bruk egenskap 2 for å finne en annen matrise hvis determinant er lik \(\Delta\):


  2. Utvid nå langs den øverste raden for å uttrykke \(\Delta\) som forskjellen mellom to produkter, hver av et tall og en \(3\times 3\) determinant:

    \(\Delta=\)

  3. Bruk egenskap 4 til å evaluere den første \(3\times 3\) determinanten:

  4. Bruk egenskap 4 til å evaluere den andre \(3\times 3\) determinanten:

  5. Deduser verdien av \(\Delta\):

generalfeedback.text: Property 2 states that the determinant of a matrix is equal to the determinant of its transpose. So the other matrix is just the transpose of the matrix in the question: \[{@AA@}^{T} = {@AAT@}\] Expanding along the top row is easiest, because of the two zeros in the row. The formula for the determinant in terms of cofactors tells us: \[\det{@AA@} = ({@ta21@}){@ta22@}-({@ta23@}){@ta24@}\] Note the minus sign, which comes from the \(4\times4\) pattern of signs. In the second of the two \(3\times3\) determinants, the second row is double the first row. Hence the determinant is zero, by Property 4. In the first of the two \(3\times3\) determinants, the third column is \({@cc/bb@}\) times the second column. Hence this determinant is also zero. Therefore \(\Delta=0\). <\span> Egenskap 2 sier at determinanten til en matrise er lik determinanten for dens transponering. Så den andre matrisen er bare transponeringen av matrisen i spørsmålet: \[{@AA@}^{T} = {@AAT@}\] Det er lettest å utvide langs den øverste raden på grunn av de to nullene i raden. Formelen for determinanten i form av kofaktorer forteller oss: \[\det{@AA@} = ({@ta21@}){@ta22@}-({@ta23@}){@ta24@}\] Legg merke til minustegnet, som kommer fra \(4\times 4\) mønsteret av tegn. I den andre av de to \(3\times 3\) determinantene, er den andre raden dobbel av den første raden. Derfor er determinanten null, ved egenskap 4. I den første av de to \(3\times3\) determinantene, er den tredje kolonnen \({@cc/bb@}\) ganger den andre kolonnen. Derfor er denne determinanten også null. Derfor \(\Delta=0\). <\span>

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øvelse

In this exercise you will use Laplace expansion along the 1st row to determine the determinant of the following matrix: I denne øvelsen skal du bruke Laplace utvidelsen langs 1st råden til å bestemme determinanten av den følgende matrise

\(A={@matrixa@}\)

Let the entries in the first row be denoted \(a_{1,1}\), \(a_{1,2}\) and \(a_{1,3}\) in the usual way. First list the cofactors \(A_{i,j}\) of these entries: La elementene i den første råden bli \(a_{1,1}\), \(a_{1,2}\) og \(a_{1,3}\) i den vanlige måten. Liste de kofaktorene\(A_{i,j}\) av disse elementene:

\(A_{1,1}=\)[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

\(A_{1,2}=\)[[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

\(A_{1,3}=\)[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

Use these values to evaluate the determinant of \(A\): Bruk de verdiene til å evaluere determinanten til \(A\):

[[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

generalfeedback.text:
To obtain the cofactor of an element of a \(3 \times 3\) matrix we multiply the minor of that element by the corresponding sign from the \(3 \times 3\) array of signs. For å få kofaktoren av en element til en \(3 \times 3\) matrise vi multipliserer den 'minor'-en av elementen ved den korresponderende tegn fra den \(3 \times 3\) array av tegnene.

For \(a_{1,1}\), the sign is \(+\), and the minor is \(\det{@matrix([AA[2,2], AA[2,3]], [AA[3,2], AA[3,3]])@}\). Hence the cofactor is \({@ta1@}.\) For \(a_{1,1}\), tegnet er \(+\), og 'minor'-en til dette er \(\det{@matrix([AA[2,2], AA[2,3]], [AA[3,2], AA[3,3]])@}\). Herved er kofaktoren: \({@ta1@}.\)

For \(a_{1,2}\), the sign is \(-\), and the minor is \(\det{@matrix([AA[2,1], AA[2,3]], [AA[3,1], AA[3,3]])@}\). Hence the cofactor is \({@ta2@}.\) For \(a_{1,2}\), tegnet er \(-\), og 'minor'-en til dette er \(\det{@matrix([AA[2,1], AA[2,3]], [AA[3,1], AA[3,3]])@}\). Da er kofaktoren: \({@ta2@}.\)

For \(a_{1,3}\), the sign is \(+\) again, and the minor is \(\det{@matrix([AA[2,1], AA[2,2]], [AA[3,1], AA[3,2]])@}\). Hence the cofactor is \({@ta3@}.\) For \(a_{1,3}\), tegnet er \(+\), og 'minor'-en til dette er \(\det{@matrix([AA[2,1], AA[2,2]], [AA[3,1], AA[3,2]])@}\). Da er kofaktoren: \({@ta3@}.\)

The determinant of \(A\) is now given by the formula: \[\det(A) = {@CC@} = {@DD@}\] Determinanten \(A\) kan beregnes da ved bruk av formelen: \[\det(A) = {@CC@} = {@DD@}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Using any of the properties of determinants to minimise the arithmetic, evaluate the determinants of the following matrices: \[A = {@matrixa@}, \qquad B={@matrixb@}\]

  1. \(\det(A)=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]
  2. \(\det(B)=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. Use Property 4 to take out common factors in the rows and the columns of \(A\): \[\det(A)=720\det{@reducedAA@}\] Note that the first entry in column 3 is a \(1\). This is very useful: use Property 5 to simplify the matrix by adding/subtracting an appropriate multiple of column 3 from columns 1 and 2: \[\det(A)=720\det{@veryreducedAA@}\] The value of this determinant is most easily found by expanding along the top row. Since two of the entries are \(0\) and the third is \(1\), and the sign associated to the \(1\) is \(+\), the value is just the determinant of \({@relevantminor@}\), which is {@DD@}.

    Therefore the determinant of \(A\) is \({@DD@}\cdot720={@ta1@}.\)

  2. The determinant of \(B\) is \(0\) because row 4 is \(2\) times row 1.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øvelse

Find the cofactors of \(x,y,z\) in the following determinant: Finn kofaktorene til \(x,y,z\) i følgende determinanten:

\[\begin{vmatrix} {@AA[1,1]@} & {@AA[1,2]@} & {@AA[1,3]@} \\ {@AA[2,1]@} & {@AA[2,2]@} & {@AA[2,3]@} \\ x & y & z \end{vmatrix}\]

Cofactor of \(x\): Kofaktor av \(x\):

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

Cofactor of \(y\): Kofaktor av \(y\):

[[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

Cofactor of \(z\): Kofaktor av \(z\):

[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
To obtain the cofactor of an element of a \(3 \times 3\) matrix we multiply the minor of that element by the corresponding sign from the \(3 \times 3\) array of signs. For å finne kofaktoren til et element i en \(3 \times 3\) matrise, multipliserer vi minoren til dette elementet med det tilsvarende fortegnet fra matrisen med fortegn på \(3 \times 3\).


We are given the determinant: \(\begin{vmatrix} {@AA[1,1]@} & {@AA[1,2]@} & {@AA[1,3]@} \\ {@AA[2,1]@} & {@AA[2,2]@} & {@AA[2,3]@} \\ x & y & z \end{vmatrix}.\) Vi har gitt determinanten: \(\begin{vmatrix} {@AA[1,1]@} & {@AA[1,2]@} & {@AA[1,3]@} \\ {@AA[2,1]@} & {@AA[2,2]@} & {@AA[2,3]@} \\ x & y & z \end{vmatrix}.\)


For \(x\), the sign is \(+\), and the minor is \(\det {@MMx@}\). Hence the cofactor is \({@ta1@}.\) For \(x\), tegnet er \(+\), og minoren er \(\det{@MMx@}\). Derfor er cofaktoren \({@ta1@}.\)

For \(y\), the sign is \(-\), and the minor is \(\det {@MMy@}\). Hence the cofactor is \({@ta2@}.\) For \(y\), the sign is \(-\), and the minor is \(\det {@MMy@}\). Hence the cofactor is \({@ta2@}.\)

For \(z\), the sign is \(+\) again, and the minor is \(\det {@MMz@}\). Hence the cofactor is \({@ta3@}.\) For \(z\), tegnet er igjen \(+\), og den mindre verdien er \(\det {@MMz@}\). Dermed er cofaktoren \({@ta3@}.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Oppgave.

Using any of the properties of determinants to minimise the arithmetic, evaluate the following determinant: Ved å bruke egenskapene til determinanter for å minimere aritmetikken, evaluer determinanten:

\[\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -3 & 1 \\ 4 & 2 & -1 \\ -2 & 5 & 3 \end{vmatrix}\]

\(\Delta=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the determinant: \(\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} y+z & x+z & x+y \\ x & y & z \\ 1 & 1 & 1 \end{vmatrix}.\) Vi har determinanten: \[\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} y+z & x+z & x+y \\ x & y & z \\ 1 & 1 & 1 \end{vmatrix}.\]


The sum of the first and second rows is the row matrix \(\begin{bmatrix}x+y+z & x+y+z & x+y+z\end{bmatrix}\), which is \(x+y+z\) times the third row. Therefore the determinant is zero, by Properties 4 and 5. Summen av første og andre rad er radmatrisen \(\begin{bmatrix}x+y+z & x+y+z & x+y+z\end{bmatrix}\), som er \(x+y+z\) ganger tredje rad. Derfor blir determinanten null, ved egenskap 4 og 5.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
